byline.contributor: Elisabeth Malkin reported from Mexico City, and Gene Palumbo from San Salvador.
byline.original: By ELISABETH MALKIN and GENE PALUMBO

abstract: El Salvador's Supreme Court strikes down amnesty law that protected soldiers, rebels and death squads for over two decades from war crimes charges stemming from country's civil war.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court struck down a law that had protected members of the military, rebel groups and death squads for more than two decades.

headline.main: Salvadoran Court Overturns Wartime Amnesty, Paving Way for Prosecutions
headline.print_headline: El Salvador Overturns Amnesty Tied to War Crimes

snippet: The Supreme Court struck down a law that had protected members of the military, rebel groups and death squads for more than two decades....

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
